intro: Eleocharis cordillerana, commonly known as the Sierra marsh sedge, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. This species typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense clusters. Eleocharis cordillerana plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
